instruction: place a coal burner mining drill, with an inserter next to the drill facing towards it, add a transport belt connecting the drill drop off to the inserter pick up to complete the loop
objective: place a coal burner mining drill, with an inserter next to the drill facing towards it, add a transport belt connecting the drill drop off to the inserter pick up to complete the loop
steps:
To achieve this objective in Factorio, follow these steps:

1. Place a coal burner mining drill:
   - Find a suitable coal patch on the map
   - Select the coal burner mining drill from your inventory
   - Place it directly on top of the coal patch

2. Add an inserter next to the drill:
   - Select an inserter from your inventory
   - Place it adjacent to the coal burner mining drill
   - Ensure the inserter is facing towards the drill (the arrow on the inserter should point towards the drill)

3. Add a transport belt:
   - Select a transport belt from your inventory
   - Start placing the belt from the output side of the coal burner mining drill
   - Extend the belt towards the input side of the inserter

4. Complete the loop:
   - Continue the transport belt from the inserter's output side
   - Connect it back to the input side of the coal burner mining drill

The final setup should look like this:

[Coal] -> [Drill] -> [Belt] -> [Inserter] -> [Belt] -> [Drill]

This configuration creates a closed loop where:
- The drill mines coal and outputs it onto the belt
- The belt carries the coal to the inserter
- The inserter picks up the coal and places it back into the drill
- The drill uses the coal as fuel to continue mining

This setup ensures that the coal burner mining drill is self-sustaining, using the coal it mines to power itself and continue operation.

corrections.snippet:
# Find nearest coal patch
coal_patch = get_resource_patch(Resource.Coal, nearest(Resource.Coal))
assert coal_patch, "No coal patch found nearby"

# Place coal burner mining drill
drill_position = coal_patch.bounding_box.center
drill = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, Direction.UP, drill_position)
assert drill, f"Failed to place burner mining drill at {drill_position}"
print(f"Placed burner mining drill at {drill.position}")

# Place inserter next to the drill
inserter_position = Position(x=drill.position.x + 3, y=drill.position.y)
inserter = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter, Direction.LEFT, inserter_position)
assert inserter, f"Failed to place inserter at {inserter_position}"
print(f"Placed inserter at {inserter.position}")

# Verify inserter is facing the drill
assert inserter.direction == Direction.LEFT, f"Inserter is not facing the drill. Current direction: {inserter.direction}"

# Place transport belt connecting drill to inserter
belt_start = drill.drop_position
belt_end = inserter.pickup_position
belts = connect_entities(belt_start, belt_end, Prototype.TransportBelt)
assert belts, f"Failed to place transport belt from {belt_start} to {belt_end}"
print(f"Placed {len(belts)} transport belt(s) from drill to inserter")

# Complete the loop with another transport belt
loop_start = inserter.drop_position
loop_end = drill.position
loop_belts = connect_entities(loop_start, loop_end, Prototype.TransportBelt)
assert loop_belts, f"Failed to complete the loop from {loop_start} to {loop_end}"
print(f"Placed {len(loop_belts)} transport belt(s) to complete the loop")

# Verify the setup
entities = inspect_entities(drill.position, radius=5)
assert entities.get_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill), "Burner mining drill not found in setup"
assert entities.get_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter), "Inserter not found in setup"
assert any(e.name == "transport-belt" for e in entities.entities), "Transport belts not found in setup"

print("Successfully set up coal mining loop with burner mining drill, inserter, and transport belts")

corrections.snippet:
# Find nearest coal patch
coal_patch = get_resource_patch(Resource.Coal, nearest(Resource.Coal))
assert coal_patch, "No coal patch found nearby"

# Move to the coal patch
move_to(coal_patch.bounding_box.center)

# Place coal burner mining drill
drill_position = coal_patch.bounding_box.center
drill = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, Direction.UP, drill_position)
assert drill, f"Failed to place burner mining drill at {drill_position}"
print(f"Placed burner mining drill at {drill.position}")

# Place inserter next to the drill
inserter_position = place_entity_next_to(Prototype.BurnerInserter, drill.position, Direction.RIGHT)
assert inserter_position, f"Failed to place inserter next to the drill"
inserter = get_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter, inserter_position.position)
assert inserter, f"Failed to get placed inserter"
print(f"Placed inserter at {inserter.position}")

# Rotate inserter to face the drill
rotate_entity(inserter, Direction.LEFT)
assert inserter.direction == Direction.LEFT, f"Inserter is not facing the drill. Current direction: {inserter.direction}"

# Place transport belt connecting drill to inserter
belt_start = drill.drop_position
belt_end = inserter.pickup_position
belts = connect_entities(belt_start, belt_end, Prototype.TransportBelt)
assert belts, f"Failed to place transport belt from {belt_start} to {belt_end}"
print(f"Placed {len(belts)} transport belt(s) from drill to inserter")

# Complete the loop with another transport belt
loop_start = inserter.drop_position
loop_end = drill.position
loop_belts = connect_entities(loop_start, loop_end, Prototype.TransportBelt)
assert loop_belts, f"Failed to complete the loop from {loop_start} to {loop_end}"
print(f"Placed {len(loop_belts)} transport belt(s) to complete the loop")

# Verify the setup
entities = inspect_entities(drill.position, radius=5)
assert entities.get_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill), "Burner mining drill not found in setup"
assert entities.get_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter), "Inserter not found in setup"
assert any(e.name == "transport-belt" for e in entities.entities), "Transport belts not found in setup"

# Find nearest coal patch
coal_patch = get_resource_patch(Resource.Coal, nearest(Resource.Coal))
assert coal_patch, "No coal patch found nearby"

# Move to the coal patch
move_to(coal_patch.bounding_box.center)
print(f"Moved to coal patch at {coal_patch.bounding_box.center}")

# Place coal burner mining drill
drill_position = coal_patch.bounding_box.center
drill = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, Direction.UP, drill_position)
assert drill, f"Failed to place burner mining drill at {drill_position}"
print(f"Placed burner mining drill at {drill.position}")

# Place inserter next to the drill
inserter_position = Position(x=drill.position.x + 1, y=drill.position.y)
inserter = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter, Direction.LEFT, inserter_position)
assert inserter, f"Failed to place inserter at {inserter_position}"
print(f"Placed inserter at {inserter.position}")

# Verify inserter is facing the drill
assert inserter.direction == Direction.LEFT, f"Inserter is not facing the drill. Current direction: {inserter.direction}"

# Place transport belt connecting drill to inserter
belt_start = drill.drop_position
belt_end = inserter.pickup_position
belts = connect_entities(belt_start, belt_end, Prototype.TransportBelt)
assert belts, f"Failed to place transport belt from {belt_start} to {belt_end}"
print(f"Placed {len(belts)} transport belt(s) from drill to inserter")

# Complete the loop with another transport belt
loop_start = inserter.drop_position
loop_end = Position(x=drill.position.x, y=drill.position.y + 1)  # Place belt below the drill
loop_belts = connect_entities(loop_start, loop_end, Prototype.TransportBelt)
assert loop_belts, f"Failed to complete the loop from {loop_start} to {loop_end}"
print(f"Placed {len(loop_belts)} transport belt(s) to complete the loop")

# Verify the setup
entities = inspect_entities(drill.position, radius=5)
assert entities.get_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill), "Burner mining drill not found in setup"
assert entities.get_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter), "Inserter not found in setup"
assert any(e.name == "transport-belt" for e in entities.entities), "Transport belts not found in setup"

drill_position = coal_patch.bounding_box.center
drill = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, Direction.DOWN, drill_position)
assert drill, f"Failed to place burner mining drill at {drill_position}"
print(f"Placed burner mining drill at {drill.position}")

# Place inserter next to the drill
inserter_position = Position(x=drill.position.x, y=drill.position.y + 3)
inserter = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter, Direction.UP, inserter_position)
assert inserter, f"Failed to place inserter at {inserter_position}"
print(f"Placed inserter at {inserter.position}")

# Verify inserter placement and direction
inserter = get_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter, inserter_position)
assert inserter, f"Failed to get placed inserter at {inserter_position}"
assert inserter.direction == Direction.UP, f"Inserter is not facing the drill. Current direction: {inserter.direction}"

# Place transport belt connecting drill to inserter
belt_start = drill.drop_position
belt_end = inserter.pickup_position
belts = connect_entities(belt_start, belt_end, Prototype.TransportBelt)
assert belts, f"Failed to place transport belt from {belt_start} to {belt_end}"
print(f"Placed {len(belts)} transport belt(s) from drill to inserter")

# Complete the loop with another transport belt
loop_start = inserter.drop_position
loop_end = Position(x=drill.position.x, y=drill.position.y + 1)  # Place belt below the drill
loop_belts = connect_entities(loop_start, loop_end, Prototype.TransportBelt)
assert loop_belts, f"Failed to complete the loop from {loop_start} to {loop_end}"
print(f"Placed {len(loop_belts)} transport belt(s) to complete the loop")

# Verify the setup
entities = inspect_entities(drill.position, radius=5)
assert entities.get_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill), "Burner mining drill not found in setup"
assert entities.get_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter), "Inserter not found in setup"
assert any(e.name == "transport-belt" for e in entities.entities), "Transport belts not found in setup"

print("Successfully set up coal mining loop with burner mining drill, inserter, and transport belts")
